titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles A. Fenton Papers
titlestmt.author: by Andrea Benefiel and Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:11

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists primarily of material created and accumulated by Charles Fenton in the course of researching and writing books on Stephen Vincent Benét and Ernest Hemingway. Research material includes correspondence about Benét and Hemingway, Fenton's notes about their lives and careers, and index cards with which Fenton organized his research. In addition to research on Benét and Hemingway, the collection contains a smaller amount of research material on the topic of "Writer in America" and the history of The National Institute of Arts and Letters, as well as notes regarding Fenton's World War II anthology and notes on American writers. The collection also contains professional and personal papers, including manuscripts and teaching materials from Fenton's years as a lecturer at Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Charles A. Fenton, Jr., 1961.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Charles A. Fenton Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles A. Fenton Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection received preliminary processing at or around the time of acquisition. Further rehousing and description were carried out in 2012.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Charles Andrews Fenton Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library. MS 206.

bioghist.head: Charles A. Fenton (1919-1960)
bioghist.p: Charles A. Fenton, author and educator, was born in Springfield, Massachusetts in 1919. He is the author of The Apprenticeship of Ernest Hemingway: The Early Years (1954) and Stephen Vincent Benét: The Life and Times of an American Man of Letters (1958). He also edited The Best Short Stories of World War II: An American Anthology (1957) and Selected Letters of Stephen Vincent Benét (1960). He taught English at Yale from 1948 to 1958, and at Duke University from 1958 until his death in 1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of material created and accumulated by Charles Fenton in the course of researching and writing books on Stephen Vincent Benét and Ernest Hemingway. Research material includes correspondence about Benét and Hemingway, Fenton's notes about their lives and careers, and index cards with which Fenton organized his research. In addition to research on Benét and Hemingway, the collection contains a smaller amount of research material on the topic of "Writer in America" and the history of The National Institute of Arts and Letters, as well as notes regarding Fenton's World War II anthology and notes on American writers. The collection also contains professional and personal papers, including manuscripts and teaching materials from Fenton's years as a lecturer at Duke University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Stephen Vincent Benét Research Material, 1866-1960. II. Ernest Hemingway Research Material, 1929-1959. III. Other Research Material, circa 1955. IV. Personal and Professional Papers, 1946-1965.

controlaccess.subject: American literature -- 20th Century
Authors, American -- 20th Century -- Archives
World War, 1939-1945 -- Literature and the war

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized in three subseries: Correspondence, Notes, and Card Files. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically by correspondent or subject. Notes are arranged roughly alphabetically by topic. The card files are arranged alphabetically by index type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. contains Fenton's research materials relating to Stephen Vincent Benét: The Life and Times of an American Man of Letters (1958). The correspondence subseries contains Fenton's correspondence, as well as some copies of letters between Benét and others. The series also contains Fenton's research notes and index card files pertaining to the biography.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Correspondence, Notes, and Card Files. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically by correspondent, followed by copies of Hemingway correspondence. Notes are arranged roughly alphabetically by topic. Card files are arranged alphabetically by index type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II. contains Fenton's correspondence regarding his biography about Ernest Hemingway, as well as copies of Hemingway's correspondence with Fenton, Guy Hickok, and others. It also contains Fenton's research notes and card files for the biography.

did.unittitle: Hemingway in Chicago, [Co-operative Commonwealth], Hemingway and Anderson
The Star as a training school
The Old Man and the Sea (1952)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: Writer in America, The National Institute of Arts and Letters, World War II Anthology, and Notes on American Writers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. contains Fenton's research notes on the following topics: Writer in America, the history and members of The National Institute of Arts and Letters, Fenton's World War II anthology, and American writers.

1930s, including notes on Stephen Vincent Benét
Puritan. E. Taylor, Bradford, Shepard, Sewall, Bradstreet
Ransom, John Crowe and Allen Tate

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV. contains primarily professional papers relating to Fenton's career as a writer and lecturer, as well as a small amount of personal papers and correspondence, and manuscripts.
